entries.title: 6-year-old boy in police custody after shooting teacher in Virginia
entries.description: A 6-year-old boy is in police custody after he shot a teacher at Richneck Elementary School in Newport News, Virginia, Friday afternoon, according to Newport News Police Chief Steve Drew.

entries.title: Judge denies motion from Trump and family to dismiss $250 million lawsuit
entries.description: A New York state judge on Friday denied motions from former President Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump and Ivanka Trump to dismiss the New York attorney general's $250 million lawsuit, finding some of the arguments "frivolous."

entries.title: US announces nearly $3 billion in military aid to Ukraine, but House drama causes worry over future help
entries.description: • Opinion: Russia blaming its own dead soldiers

entries.title: Bam Margera says he was 'pronounced dead' after seizure during Covid battle
entries.description: Bam Margera is recovering from a recent hospitalization for Covid-19.

entries.title: Alzheimer's drug lecanemab receives accelerated approval in US amid safety concerns
entries.description: The US Food and Drug Administration granted accelerated approval Friday for the Alzheimer's disease drug lecanemab, one of the first experimental dementia drugs to appear to slow the progression of cognitive decline.

entries.title: A secret to Romans' building success has been revealed by scientists
entries.description: The majestic structures of ancient Rome have survived for millennia — a testament to the ingenuity of Roman engineers, who perfected the use of concrete.

entries.title: Son of 'El Chapo' held in top-security prison after 29 killed in arrest operation
entries.description: Arrested drug cartel leader Ovidio Guzmán, the son of Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzmán, is being held in the Altiplano maximum security federal prison, officials said Friday, following an intense operation in northern Mexico that led to the deaths of 29 people.

entries.title: Rep. McCarthy began a GOP call saying a deal hasn't been reached but that talks are in a 'good position'
No deal yet as GOP's House speaker fight enters fourth day
Judge suspends law license of lawyer for Alex Jones following Sandy Hook document leaks
entries.description: A Connecticut judge suspended the law license of a lawyer for right-wing conspiracy theorist Alex Jones after he allegedly improperly released court documents from the Sandy Hook defamation case.

entries.title: Buffalo Bills say Damar Hamlin's breathing tube was removed and he's been able to talk with family and doctors
The royal family's silence is deafening as Prince Harry's damaging new book leaks
US returns looted antiquity to Palestinian Authority for first time ever
entries.description: For the first time ever, the United States has returned a looted antiquity to the Palestinian Authority -- an Iron Age ivory "cosmetic spoon" that is almost 3,000 years old.

entries.title: Watch: Late night hosts react to Prince Harry's memoir
entries.description: Late night talk show hosts poked fun at some of the reported revelations from Prince Harry's upcoming memoir "Spare."

entries.title: Lisa Rinna is leaving 'Real Housewives of Beverly Hills'
entries.description: Lisa Rinna has left the building.

entries.title: 'This could be bad for you': WSJ reporter handcuffed while on assignment
entries.description: The Wall Street Journal is demanding answers from the Phoenix Police Department. Its journalist Dion Rabouin was detained and handcuffed by an officer while reporting outside a Chase Bank back in November. CNN affiliate ABC15 Arizona reports.

entries.title: At least 10 injured outside Miami area restaurant where rapper French Montana was shooting a video
entries.description: At least 10 people were injured in a shooting outside a Miami Gardens, Florida restaurant where rapper French Montana was shooting a music video, according to statements from the restaurant and Miami Dade Fire Rescue (MDFR).

entries.title: Theophilus London reunited with family after being reported missing
entries.description: Rap artist and musician Theophilus London has been found after being reported missing by his family, according to Los Angeles police.

entries.title: Dave Bautista has 'relief' 'Guardians of the Galaxy' role is over
entries.description: Dave Bautista is thankful for the role which helped to make him famous, and he's ready to flex new muscles.

entries.title: Putin's unilateral ceasefire 'intended to damage Ukraine's reputation,' think tank says
One of Princess Diana's famous dresses is going up for sale
entries.description: It might not be as famous as her head-turning "revenge dress," but an aubergine-colored silk velvet piece is still one of Princess Diana's most iconic gowns. The late royal wore it for both an official royal portrait in 1991 and an intimate Vanity Fair spread in 1997, just before her death.

entries.title: 'He's not a leader': Fanone weighs in on McCarthy's struggle to become House speaker
entries.description: CNN law enforcement analyst and former DC Metropolitan Police officer Michael Fanone sits down with Kaitlan Collins to discuss Kevin McCarthy and his struggle to get enough votes for the House speakership.

entries.title: Video shows driver crash, flip over inside car wash
entries.description: A 77-year-old driver was rescued 90 minutes after his car crashed and flipped over inside a Pennsylvania car wash.

entries.title: Great Salt Lake will disappear in 5 years without massive 'emergency rescue,' scientists say
entries.description: The Great Salt Lake in Utah is facing "unprecedented danger," experts say, as it has fallen to an alarmingly low level amid a climate change-fueled megadrought that's tightening its grip in the West.

entries.title: Prince Harry criticized by British military figures after claiming he killed 25 Taliban fighters in Afghanistan
entries.description: Prince Harry has drawn criticism from some security and military figures after claiming in his autobiography that he killed 25 Taliban fighters while serving for the British Army in Afghanistan.

entries.title: These three big unknowns will drive markets in 2023
entries.description: We're in the salad days of the New Year — that period where many feel refreshed and motivated and perhaps even optimistic about the year to come. There's a certain clarity that comes during this time in January.

entries.title: Prominent Kenyan LGBTQ activist Edwin Chiloba reportedly found dead
entries.description: Kenyan police have discovered the body of a prominent LGBTQ rights campaigner stuffed inside a metal box in the west of the country, local media reported on Friday.

entries.title: How a medication abortion, also known as an 'abortion pill,' works
entries.description: Mifepristone, one of the two drugs used for medication abortion, may soon be available at some retail pharmacies, according to a new ruling by the US Food and Drug Administration.

entries.title: Watch preview clip from Prince Harry's interview on "60 minutes"
entries.description: Prince Harry sat down with Anderson Cooper for a "60 Minutes" interview, to discuss his upcoming memoir 'Spare.'

entries.title: Southwest meltdown may cost the airline up to $825 million
entries.description: The cost of the service meltdown at Southwest Airlines over the year-end holidays cost the airline nearly $1 billion and will cause the company to report a loss rather in the fourth quarter, the airline said in a filing on Friday.

entries.title: See January's wolf moon light up the sky
entries.description: January's full moon will light up the sky on Friday, and will be visible all around the world.

entries.title: Buffalo Bills trainer Denny Kellington saved Damar Hamlin's life on the field, head coach says
entries.description: Just seconds after Buffalo Bills player Damar Hamlin collapsed on the field from cardiac arrest on Monday, medical personnel swarmed onto the field in an immediate response that has been widely credited for the player's steps toward recovery.

entries.title: Why Cristiano Ronaldo's move to Saudi Arabia means so much for the Gulf monarchy's sporting ambitions
entries.description: It's a partnership that's been hailed as "history in the making."

entries.title: This airline has new designer uniforms -- including jumpsuits
entries.description: Some people say flying just isn't glamorous enough. And as airlines battle to cast themselves as the sleekest team in the skies, another brand has heard that complaint.

entries.title: Ukrainian postal workers deliver pensions as shells explode
entries.description: CNN's Ben Wedeman reports from the town of Siversk, Ukraine, where a mobile post office has become a lifeline for the elderly as it delivers their state pensions to buy supplies from the handful of shops still open.

entries.title: Record signing Jack Grealish admits move to Manchester City has been 'so much more difficult' than expected
entries.description: Jack Grealish says moving to Manchester City has been "so much more difficult" than he anticipated after he had a hand in the team's crucial 1-0 win against Chelsea.

entries.title: The surprising twist in the battle for democracy
entries.description: A year ago, the reverberations of the January 6 attack still loomed large. Russia was accusing the United States of "hysteria" for claiming Moscow planned to invade Ukraine. Even Ukraine was skeptical. The leaders of China and Russia, looking confident, seemed prepared to defy the world. Democracy was on the defensive across the globe from South America to Asia. A historic test was about to play out.

entries.title: Tesla cuts prices in China for the second time in three months as demand slows
entries.description: Tesla has slashed car prices in China for the second time in less than three months, in an effort to boost sales amidst slowing demand in the world's largest car market.

entries.title: Stabenow's retirement gives Republicans an opening in Michigan. But will they take it?
entries.description: Longtime Michigan Sen. Debbie Stabenow is calling it quits and will not stand for reelection in 2024.

entries.title: Gianluca Vialli, Italy football great, dies aged 58
entries.description: Italy football great Gianluca Vialli has died aged 58 after what he described as his "journey" with an "unwelcome travel companion" -- pancreatic cancer.

entries.title: UK will make it harder for key workers to strike
entries.description: The UK government is planning to introduce a new law forcing workers in key public sectors such as ambulance services to maintain a basic level of service during strike action or risk dismissal.

entries.title: Inflation drops sharply in Europe but some prices are still rising
entries.description: Inflation in Europe continued to decline in December as energy prices rose at a slower pace.

entries.title: McCarthy fights for deal in longest speaker contest in 164 years
entries.description: Kevin McCarthy is locked in a fight for his political future as the California Republican attempts to win the votes he needs to become speaker of the US House of Representatives in what has now become the longest contest in 164 years.

entries.title: Look of the Week: Keke Palmer shows off baby bump in shimmering Michael Kors red carpet dress
entries.description: While attending the New York Film Critics Circle Awards (NYFCC) on January 4, Keke Palmer stepped onto the red carpet for the first time since announcing she was expecting a child with boyfriend Darius Jackson. The actor revealed the pregnancy during her opening monologue on Saturday Night Live back in December.

entries.title: US and Germany to supply Ukraine with fighting vehicles
entries.description:
• Putin deploys Russian warship with Zircon hypersonic missile: state media
• Opinion: With Russia's fading power in Ukraine, a second catastrophe looms
• Video: Russia expert on possible motives of Putin's ceasefire order

entries.title: Two years after US Capitol attack, investigation into Trump and insurrection enters new phase
entries.description: Two years after rioters stormed the US Capitol, the Justice Department's sprawling criminal investigation into the effort to block the peaceful transition of power enters a new phase with the special counsel adding two right-hand prosecutors to an experienced team that will ultimately determine whether former President Donald Trump or his allies should face prosecution.

entries.title: Idaho suspect in student murders thoroughly cleaned vehicle, also seen wearing surgical gloves multiple times outside family home, source says
entries.description: The man accused of murdering four University of Idaho students in November had thoroughly cleaned the interior and exterior of his car and was also seen wearing surgical gloves multiple times before being apprehended, a law enforcement source tells CNN.

entries.title: Russia is blaming its own dead soldiers
entries.description: The war in Ukraine entered 2023 with its deadliest attack yet on Russian troops -- and an attempt by Moscow to shift the bulk of blame onto its own dead soldiers.

entries.title: Jessica Pegula upsets world No. 1 Iga Świątek in United Cup semifinals
entries.description: Jessica Pegula, the daughter of Buffalo Bills owner Terry Pegula, secured her first career victory over a world No. 1 on Friday, beating Poland's Iga Świątek 6-2 6-2 in the opening match of the United Cup semifinal in Sydney.

entries.title: Hundreds of drones are lighting up the night sky in Dubai
entries.description: In recent years, Dubai has set a number of world records with its impressive fireworks displays.  To ring in 2023, fireworks and laser shows were seen across the United Arab Emirates, including at the Burj Khalifa, which aimed to hold the biggest laser display of all time.

entries.title: Ukraine must accept 'new territorial realities' to negotiate, Putin tells Turkey's Erdogan
A Chinese company has signed an oil extraction deal with Afghanistan's Taliban
entries.description: The ruling Taliban has signed a deal with a Chinese company to extract oil from northern Afghanistan's Amu Darya basin as the radical Islamist group attempts to bolster the South Asian nation's increasingly impoverished and isolated economy.

entries.title: A Wall Street Journal reporter was handcuffed by police while standing outside a Chase Bank. The newspaper is demanding answers
entries.description: The Wall Street Journal is demanding answers from the Phoenix Police Department after an officer detained and handcuffed one of its reporters outside a Chase Bank — an incident that press freedom advocates say raises First Amendment concerns and mirrors a larger, growing hostility from local law enforcement toward journalists across the country.

entries.title: Damar Hamlin has made 'substantial improvement' following in-game cardiac arrest, medical team says, but his road to recovery could be long
entries.description: Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin has made "substantial improvement" in the hospital following his mid-game cardiac arrest on Monday, doctors said, and is now awake and moving his hands and feet.

entries.title: Hawaii's Kilauea volcano is erupting once again
entries.description: Weeks after Hawaii's Mauna Loa erupted for the first time in decades, neighboring volcano Kilauea is showing activity again after a brief pause, according to officials.

entries.title: 'Mad Dog' surfer dies riding giant waves in Nazaré, Portugal
entries.description: Veteran Brazilian surfer Marcio Freire died on Thursday while practising tow-in surfing on the giant waves in Nazaré on the central coast of Portugal, the local maritime authority said.

entries.title: Analysis: McCarthy being consumed by MAGA politics he pushed
entries.description: Kevin McCarthy is the latest Republican leader to find out that it's impossible to get ahead of his party's inexorable march to its far-right extremes.

entries.title: Can international tourists visit China? Everything you need to know about reopening
entries.description: • China to open border with Hong Kong after three years of tight control

entries.title: Kyiv dismisses Putin's ceasefire as 'hypocrisy'
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered his defense minister to implement a temporary ceasefire in Ukraine for 36 hours this week to allow Orthodox Christians to attend Christmas services, according to a Kremlin statement Thursday. But the proposal was swiftly dismissed as "hypocrisy" by Ukrainian officials.

entries.title: Hear why Russia expert has doubts about Putin's call for a temporary ceasefire
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered his defense minister to implement a temporary ceasefire in Ukraine for 36 hours this week to allow Orthodox Christians to attend Christmas services. But the proposal was swiftly dismissed as "hypocrisy" by Ukrainian officials. CNN's John Vause talks to Russian expert Jill Dougherty, Adjunct Professor of Georgetown University, on the possible motives of Putin's ceasefire order.

entries.title: Watch the wackiest moments from the House Speaker fiasco
entries.description: CNN's Jeanne Moos reports the House is not in order.

entries.title: Chalian: McCarthy showing he doesn't have the credentials to lead
entries.description: CNN's David Chalian says that Kevin McCarthy has appeared to be less of a leader and more of a follower since his visit to former President Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago in the wake of the January 6, 2021, US Capitol attack.

entries.title: A portrait of one of the few young, female truckers in France
entries.description: A young couple embraces in front of the grill of a 750-horsepower Volvo truck, their cream and beige ensembles matching the commercial vehicle's slick exterior. They pose for the camera, her face partially obscured by the playful roundness of her pantsuit's tulle shoulder pouf.

entries.title: Air India's handling of unruly passengers criticized by regulator
entries.description: Air India faced criticism on Thursday, January 5 from the country's aviation regulator for its handling of an unruly passenger on a flight from New York in November, and also acknowledged that a second similar incident occurred last month on a flight from Paris to New Delhi.

entries.title: Peloton fined $19 million for unsafe treadmills
entries.description: Peloton has agreed to pay a $19 million fine for failing to promptly report treadmill hazards and for distributing recalled treadmills, the Consumer Products Safety Commission said Thursday.

entries.title: McCarthy after failing on 11th vote: 'It's OK if it takes a little longer'
entries.description: The House has adjourned until noon Friday after Rep. Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) failed to win a majority of votes across 11 ballots over three days in his push to become House speaker. CNN's Manu Raju and reporters spoke to him after the session.

entries.title: Emma Raducanu leaves court injured and in tears ahead of Australian Open
entries.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu retired at 6-0 5-7 in her second-round match against Slovakian Viktoria Kuzmova at the WTA 250 Auckland Classic on Thursday after rolling her ankle, casting doubt on her participation at this month's Australian Open.

entries.title: US to send Bradley vehicles to Ukraine as part of new aid package
entries.description: The United States will supply Ukraine with Bradley fighting vehicles as part of a new security assistance package to the country as it nears the one-year anniversary of Russia's invasion.

entries.title: Opinion: The biggest loser in the race for House speaker
entries.description: Republican Rep. Kevin McCarthy is locked in a power struggle in the bid to become House Speaker -- a position he has long strived for and previously failed to secure in 2015.
